items.title: Charlie Kirk shooting latest: Utah governor confirms identity of suspect and says family friend turned him in
items.standfirst: Spencer Cox says Tyler Robinson, 22, told family friend he had shot Kirk; FBI director says suspect was taken into custody on Thursday eveningCharlie Kirk shooting: Utah governor confirms arrest of suspectWhat we know after suspect’s arrest: details of messages and gun casings emergeA video, a pastor and a tense meeting: timeline of suspect’s arrestHere are some images coming to us via the wires.Democracy is the way that we have diverse societies that don’t kill each other, largely,” Lilliana Mason, a leading scholar of partisanship, observed recently. She added: “As soon as we stop believing in it, it disappears.” Dr Mason’s own research suggests that there is sharply rising tolerance of political violence. On Wednesday, it claimed one more victim. Continue reading...

items.title: Charlie Kirk shooting: Utah governor confirms arrest of suspect
items.standfirst: Spencer Cox identifies suspect as 22-year-old Tyler Robinson, who was arrested near the border of Utah and ArizonaCharlie Kirk shooting – follow latest updatesCharlie Kirk shooting suspect: details of messages and gun casings emergeA suspect has been arrested in southern Utah in connection with the fatal shooting of rightwing activist Charlie Kirk, Spencer Cox said on Friday morning, identifying the man as 22-year-old Tyler Robinson.“We got him,” the Utah governor said at a press conference, adding that Robinson was arrested and taken into custody in Washington county, which is close to the state border with Arizona, on Thursday at 10pm local time. Continue reading...
items.content: Spencer Cox identifies suspect as 22-year-old Tyler Robinson, who was arrested near the border of Utah and ArizonaCharlie Kirk shooting – follow latest updatesCharlie Kirk shooting suspect: details of messages and gun casings emergeA suspect has been arrested in southern Utah in connection with the fatal shooting of rightwing activist Charlie Kirk, Spencer Cox said on Friday morning, identifying the man as 22-year-old Tyler Robinson.“We got him,” the Utah governor said at a press conference, adding that Robinson was arrested and taken into custody in Washington county, which is close to the state border with Arizona, on Thursday at 10pm local time. Continue reading...

items.title: Suspect confessed to father about Charlie Kirk shooting, officials say
items.standfirst: The man accused of fatally shooting conservative activist Charlie Kirk had confessed to his father about the killing, officials said Friday. Tyler Robinson, 22, was arrested Thursday night. CBS News' Anna Schecter and Fin Gomez have more.
items.content: The man accused of fatally shooting conservative activist Charlie Kirk had confessed to his father about the killing, officials said Friday. Tyler Robinson, 22, was arrested Thursday night. CBS News' Anna Schecter and Fin Gomez have more.

items.title: Murder of Charlie Kirk: 'There's way too much political violence in the US'
items.standfirst: The suspect in custody in connection with the assassination of Charlie Kirk is a 22-year-old from Utah, authorities. Utah Gov. Spencer Cox identified the man as Tyler Robinson. Cox was joined by FBI Director Kash Patel and other officials at a news conference announcing the arrest. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective, Erin Ogunkeye welcomes Jack Cloonan, Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) agent assigned to the Osama bin Laden team in the FBI's New York field office.
items.content: The suspect in custody in connection with the assassination of Charlie Kirk is a 22-year-old from Utah, authorities. Utah Gov. Spencer Cox identified the man as Tyler Robinson. Cox was joined by FBI Director Kash Patel and other officials at a news conference announcing the arrest. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective, Erin Ogunkeye welcomes Jack Cloonan, Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) agent assigned to the Osama bin Laden team in the FBI's New York field office.

items.title: Ex-FBI agent breaks down evidence uncovered in Charlie Kirk shooting investigation

items.title: What's next after suspect arrested in Charlie Kirk assassination
items.standfirst: A suspect was arrested in the assassination of Charlie Kirk, officials announced Friday. Utah Gov. Spencer Cox said the suspect, identified as Tyler Robinson, had confessed to carrying out the shooting at Utah Valley University to his father. CBS News' Scott MacFarlane and Natalie Brand have more. Former FBI agent Doug Kouns also joins to discuss.
items.content: A suspect was arrested in the assassination of Charlie Kirk, officials announced Friday. Utah Gov. Spencer Cox said the suspect, identified as Tyler Robinson, had confessed to carrying out the shooting at Utah Valley University to his father. CBS News' Scott MacFarlane and Natalie Brand have more. Former FBI agent Doug Kouns also joins to discuss.

items.title: Officials share what led to suspect's arrest in Charlie Kirk assassination
items.standfirst: Officials announced Friday the arrest of Tyler Robinson, the man accused of fatally shooting conservative activist Charlie Kirk at an event in Utah. Authorities shared new details on what led to the suspect's arrest. CBS News contributor Sam Vinograd, and CBS News correspondents Carter Evans, Scott MacFarlane and Natalie Brand have the latest.
items.content: Officials announced Friday the arrest of Tyler Robinson, the man accused of fatally shooting conservative activist Charlie Kirk at an event in Utah. Authorities shared new details on what led to the suspect's arrest. CBS News contributor Sam Vinograd, and CBS News correspondents Carter Evans, Scott MacFarlane and Natalie Brand have the latest.

items.title: 'We got him': Suspect detained in Charlie Kirk shooting, named as Tyler Robinson
items.standfirst: A young Utah man suspected of killing the influential conservative activist Charlie Kirk at a university in the city of Orem was in custody on Friday, Utah Governor Spencer Cox told reporters. The suspect, identified as Tyler Robinson, had confessed to a family friend – or "implied that he had committed the murder" to that friend – and that person in turn had contacted the Washington County sheriff's office on Thursday.
items.content: A young Utah man suspected of killing the influential conservative activist Charlie Kirk at a university in the city of Orem was in custody on Friday, Utah Governor Spencer Cox told reporters. The suspect, identified as Tyler Robinson, had confessed to a family friend – or "implied that he had committed the murder" to that friend – and that person in turn had contacted the Washington County sheriff's office on Thursday.

items.title: Trump says Kirk killer caught with 'high degree of certainty'
items.standfirst: The suspect in the Charlie Kirk assassination has been captured, President Donald Trump said Friday in an announcement representing a significant breakthrough in the investigation into a targeted killing that raised fresh alarms about political violence in the United States. “With a high degree of certainty, we have him,” Trump announced in a live interview on Fox News Chanel. France 24's Fraser Jackson has the latest.
items.content: The suspect in the Charlie Kirk assassination has been captured, President Donald Trump said Friday in an announcement representing a significant breakthrough in the investigation into a targeted killing that raised fresh alarms about political violence in the United States. “With a high degree of certainty, we have him,” Trump announced in a live interview on Fox News Chanel. France 24's Fraser Jackson has the latest.

items.content: A suspect in the fatal shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk at a Utah university has been taken into custody, U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday, ending an intense manhunt that followed what Trump described as a "heinous assassination."

ai_summary: A suspect was arrested in connection to the shooting death of Charlie Kirk, a conservative activist.
The suspect, Tyler Robinson, was identified by Utah Governor Spencer Cox on Friday morning.
Robinson was arrested in Washington County, Utah, near the Arizona border on Thursday evening.
Robinson reportedly confessed to a family friend that he had shot Charlie Kirk.
The FBI took Robinson into custody after the arrest in southern Utah.

clusters.title: Brazil's great divide: Half the population doesn't trust the Supreme Court
clusters.neutral_headline: Brazil's Bolsonaro Sentenced to 27 Years in Prison

items.title: Brazil's great divide: Half the population doesn't trust the Supreme Court
items.standfirst: Brazil's Supreme Court found former President Jair Bolsonaro guilty of plotting a coup after he lost the 2022 elections, a conviction carrying a sentence of over 27 years. Bolsonaro has very narrow avenues of appeal to avoid prison. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective, Gavin Lee welcomes Anthony W. Pereira, Visiting Professor in the Brazil Institute at the School of Global Affairs at King’s College London and the Director of the Kimberly Green Latin American and Caribbean Centre at Florida International University.
items.content: Brazil's Supreme Court found former President Jair Bolsonaro guilty of plotting a coup after he lost the 2022 elections, a conviction carrying a sentence of over 27 years. Bolsonaro has very narrow avenues of appeal to avoid prison. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective, Gavin Lee welcomes Anthony W. Pereira, Visiting Professor in the Brazil Institute at the School of Global Affairs at King’s College London and the Director of the Kimberly Green Latin American and Caribbean Centre at Florida International University.

items.title: Bolsonaro Sentenced To 27 Years In Jail For Military Coup Plot
items.standfirst: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro, 70, has been sentenced to 27 years and three months in prison after being found guilty of plotting a military coup to stay in power after losing the 2022 election. Five Supreme Court justices handed down the sentence, with only one of them voting to…
items.content: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro, 70, has been sentenced to 27 years and three months in prison after being found guilty of plotting a military coup to stay in power after losing the 2022 election. Five Supreme Court justices handed down the sentence, with only one of them voting to…

items.title: Brazilians take to the streets to celebrate Bolsonaro conviction
items.standfirst: Indigenous groups and other minorities praise verdict while US officials issue warnings of possible sanctions• Operation World Cup: the murder plot at the heart of Brazil’s trial of the century• Bolsonaro sentenced to 27 years for plotting military coup in BrazilThousands of Brazilians have taken to the streets to rejoice at Jair Bolsonaro’s conviction for plotting a coup, as progressive politicians celebrated the historic move and rightwing figures linked to Donald Trump responded with anger and threats.Chile’s leftwing president, Gabriel Boric, led regional congratulations of the decision to jail Bolsonaro for 27 years for leading a criminal organisation that sought to seize power after the far-right populist lost the 2022 election. Continue reading...
items.content: Indigenous groups and other minorities praise verdict while US officials issue warnings of possible sanctions• Operation World Cup: the murder plot at the heart of Brazil’s trial of the century• Bolsonaro sentenced to 27 years for plotting military coup in BrazilThousands of Brazilians have taken to the streets to rejoice at Jair Bolsonaro’s conviction for plotting a coup, as progressive politicians celebrated the historic move and rightwing figures linked to Donald Trump responded with anger and threats.Chile’s leftwing president, Gabriel Boric, led regional congratulations of the decision to jail Bolsonaro for 27 years for leading a criminal organisation that sought to seize power after the far-right populist lost the 2022 election. Continue reading...

items.title: 'We knew that Bolsonaro would be convicted: There was more than enough evidence to convict him'
items.standfirst: A panel of Brazilian Supreme Court justices sentenced former president Jair Bolsonaro to 27 years and 3 months in prison Thursday, convicting him of attempting a coup to remain in power after his 2022 electoral defeat. Bolsonaro, who has denied any wrongdoing, is currently under house arrest in Brasília and can still appeal the ruling. "We knew he would be convicted, there was ample evidence," a source said. For deeper analysis, Erin Ogunkeye speaks with Dr. Camila Rocha, political scientist at CEBRAP.
items.content: A panel of Brazilian Supreme Court justices sentenced former president Jair Bolsonaro to 27 years and 3 months in prison Thursday, convicting him of attempting a coup to remain in power after his 2022 electoral defeat. Bolsonaro, who has denied any wrongdoing, is currently under house arrest in Brasília and can still appeal the ruling. "We knew he would be convicted, there was ample evidence," a source said. For deeper analysis, Erin Ogunkeye speaks with Dr. Camila Rocha, political scientist at CEBRAP.

items.title: Brazil’s Bolsonaro gets 27-year prison sentence for ‘attempted coup’
items.standfirst: Brazil’s Supreme Court has sentenced former President Jair Bolsonaro to 27 years in prison for plotting a coup.
items.content: Brazil’s Supreme Court has sentenced former President Jair Bolsonaro to 27 years in prison for plotting a coup.

items.title: As some celebrate, others fume after Brazil's Bolsonaro sentenced
items.standfirst: Brazil's Supreme Court on Thursday sentenced firebrand ex-president Jair Bolsonaro to 27 years in prison for coup plotting at the end of a landmark trial that divided the nation and drew US fury. As some celebrated the verdict in the streets of Brazilian cities, supporters shed tears and pleaded for an intervention from US President Donald Trump.
items.content: Brazil's Supreme Court on Thursday sentenced firebrand ex-president Jair Bolsonaro to 27 years in prison for coup plotting at the end of a landmark trial that divided the nation and drew US fury. As some celebrated the verdict in the streets of Brazilian cities, supporters shed tears and pleaded for an intervention from US President Donald Trump.

items.standfirst: Intricate plan to murder top judge, president- and vice-president elect was central to Jair Bolsonaro coup hopesThe conspirators used codenames to conceal their identities as they prepared for their mission: to plunge Brazil into chaos by assassinating a celebrity supreme court judge called Alexandre de Moraes.On an encrypted messaging group, one plotter used the alias Brazil, another Japan and a third Austria. Continue reading...
items.content: Intricate plan to murder top judge, president- and vice-president elect was central to Jair Bolsonaro coup hopesThe conspirators used codenames to conceal their identities as they prepared for their mission: to plunge Brazil into chaos by assassinating a celebrity supreme court judge called Alexandre de Moraes.On an encrypted messaging group, one plotter used the alias Brazil, another Japan and a third Austria. items.title: Bolsonaro sentenced to 27 years for plotting military coup in Brazil
items.standfirst: Former president sought to ‘annihilate’ country’s democracy after losing 2022 electionExplainer: what did Bolsonaro’s trial reveal?​Brazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro ​has been sentenced to more than 27 years in prison for plotting a military coup​ and seeking to “annihilate” the South American country’s democracy.Justices Cármen Lúcia Antunes Rocha and Cristiano Zanin ruled on ​Thursday that Bolsonaro – a former paratrooper who was elected president in 2018 – was guilty of seeking to forcibly cling to power after losing the 2022 election, meaning four of the five judges involved in the trial had found Brazil’s former leader guilty. Continue reading...
items.content: Former president sought to ‘annihilate’ country’s democracy after losing 2022 electionExplainer: what did Bolsonaro’s trial reveal?​Brazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro ​has been sentenced to more than 27 years in prison for plotting a military coup​ and seeking to “annihilate” the South American country’s democracy.Justices Cármen Lúcia Antunes Rocha and Cristiano Zanin ruled on ​Thursday that Bolsonaro – a former paratrooper who was elected president in 2018 – was guilty of seeking to forcibly cling to power after losing the 2022 election, meaning four of the five judges involved in the trial had found Brazil’s former leader guilty. Continue reading...

items.content: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro has been sentenced to 27 years and three months in prison for attempting a coup to stay in power after his 2022 election defeat.

ai_summary: Jair Bolsonaro was sentenced to over 27 years in prison by Brazil's Supreme Court.
Bolsonaro was found guilty of plotting a military coup after losing the 2022 election.
The Supreme Court justices handed down the sentence, with only one dissenting vote.
Prince Harry visited Kyiv to support soldiers wounded in the war against Russia.
Brazilians took to the streets to celebrate Bolsonaro's conviction for plotting a coup.

items.title: NATO launches 'Eastern Sentry' defence mission after Russian drone incursion in Poland
items.standfirst: NATO launched a new defense mission on Friday to reinforce Europe’s eastern flank, following Russian drone incursions into Polish airspace earlier this week. Secretary-General Mark Rutte said the new mission was a response to the “reckless and unacceptable” breach of allied territory.
items.content: NATO launched a new defense mission on Friday to reinforce Europe’s eastern flank, following Russian drone incursions into Polish airspace earlier this week. Secretary-General Mark Rutte said the new mission was a response to the “reckless and unacceptable” breach of allied territory.

items.title: Russia-Belarus drills begin as tensions high after drone incursion in Poland
items.standfirst: Thousands of troops are taking part in a joint military exercise between Russia and Belarus, as tensions with the EU run high following a Russian drone incursion into Polish airspace earlier this week.
items.content: Thousands of troops are taking part in a joint military exercise between Russia and Belarus, as tensions with the EU run high following a Russian drone incursion into Polish airspace earlier this week.

ai_summary: Russia and Belarus are conducting military drills amid high tensions with NATO.
NATO announced a new initiative, "Eastern Sentry," to strengthen Europe's eastern flank.
The new mission follows a Russian drone incursion into Polish airspace earlier in the week.
The UK is joining the NATO operation to bolster Europe's eastern flank.
Thousands of troops are participating in joint military exercises between Russia and Belarus.

items.content: Microsoft and OpenAI are getting close to an agreement on the future of their partnership. The companies said in a joint statement released Thursday (Sept. 11): “Microsoft and OpenAI have signed a non-binding memorandum of understanding (MOU) for the next phase of our partnership. We are…

items.title: OpenAI and Microsoft sign preliminary deal to revise partnership terms
items.standfirst: Companies work to finalize terms as OpenAI pursues for-profit restructuring.
items.content: On Thursday, OpenAI and Microsoft announced they have signed a non-binding agreement to revise their partnership, marking the latest development in a relationship that has grown increasingly complex as both companies compete for customers in the AI market and seek new partnerships for growing infrastructure needs. "Microsoft and OpenAI have signed a non-binding memorandum of understanding (MOU) for the next phase of our partnership," the companies wrote in a joint statement. "We are actively working to finalize contractual terms in a definitive agreement. Together, we remain focused on delivering the best AI tools for everyone, grounded in our shared commitment to safety." The announcement comes as OpenAI seeks to restructure from a nonprofit to a for-profit entity, a transition that requires Microsoft's approval, as the company is OpenAI's largest investor, with more than $13 billion committed since 2019.Read full article Comments

ai_summary: Microsoft and OpenAI are close to an agreement on their partnership.
They signed a non-binding memorandum of understanding.
The MOU is for the next phase of their partnership.
OpenAI is pursuing a for-profit restructuring.
The companies are working to finalize the terms.

items.content: Hundreds of South Korean workers arrived home from the US after they were detained in a large-scale immigration raid.

items.title: Workers detained in U.S. immigration raid arrive in South Korea to applause and protests
items.standfirst: Hundreds of South Korean workers detained in a U.S. immigration raid arrived in Seoul on Friday, ending a weeklong ordeal that has created business uncertainty and strained relations with a key U.S. ally.
items.content: Hundreds of South Korean workers detained in a U.S. immigration raid arrived in Seoul on Friday, ending a weeklong ordeal that has created business uncertainty and strained relations with a key U.S. ally.

items.title: Workers detained in immigration raid head home to a reeling South Korea
items.standfirst: While more than 300 South Korean nationals were finally on the way home Thursday, these images had already left a searing impression in this key U.S. ally.
items.content: While more than 300 South Korean nationals were finally on the way home Thursday, these images had already left a searing impression in this key U.S. ally.

ai_summary: Hundreds of South Korean workers arrived home from the US.
They were detained in a large-scale immigration raid.
The raid created business uncertainty.
It strained relations with a key US ally.
More than 300 South Korean nationals were on their way home.
